Sentencas: Polymer electrolyte and solid oxide are the two fuel cell types (PEFC, SOFC) under development in Switzerland.
Titulo: Fuels for fuel cells: Requirements and fuel processing

Sentencas: The very distinct operating temperatures of 80 degreesC (PEFC) and 800-950 degreesC (SOFC) impose fundamentally different requirements upon the nature of the fuel; normally purified H-2 for the former (CO trace) and usually synthesis gas for the latter (H-2, CO as main constituents).
Titulo: Fuels for fuel cells: Requirements and fuel processing

Sentencas: Apart from stored hydrogen, the most relevant fuels are primary hydrocarbons (natural gas, biogas, liquids....), that then need processing (chemical conversion, cleaning) up to a level compatible with the fuel cell catalysts.
Titulo: Fuels for fuel cells: Requirements and fuel processing
Fuels for fuel cells: Requirements and fuel processing

Sentencas: Fuel compositions with an emphasis on impurities are given.
Titulo: Fuels for fuel cells: Requirements and fuel processing

Sentencas: Two application examples from Swiss R&D are presented: gasoline conversion to high purity H-2 for PEFC and contaminated biogas processing for SOFC.
Titulo: Fuels for fuel cells: Requirements and fuel processing
